Name: Yaren
Description: Yaren is the de facto capital of Nauru and serves as the center of government and administration. It is located on the southern coast of the island.

Name: Aiwo
Description: Aiwo is a coastal district in the northern part of Nauru, known for its port and government offices.

Name: Anabar
Description: Anabar is located in the northern part of Nauru, with a primary focus on the phosphate mining industry.

Name: Boe
Description: Boe is a district in the western part of Nauru, with residential and administrative functions.

Name: Denigomodu
Description: Denigomodu is one of Nauru s central districts, with a mix of residential areas and economic activities.

Name: Ewa
Description: Ewa is a district located in the southeastern part of Nauru, largely residential with a focus on agriculture and fishing.

Name: Ijuw
Description: Ijuw is a district located in the southwestern part of Nauru, with a focus on agriculture and small-scale industries.

Name: Meneng
Description: Meneng is located in the western part of Nauru, with a mixture of residential areas and agricultural development.

Name: Nauru
Description: Nauru is the entire island nation and is administratively divided into districts, with Nauru s government, infrastructure, and phosphate mining located throughout.
